meanings.sent1: The bouncer evited the troublemaker from the club.
meanings.sent2: The teacher evited the disruptive student from the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was evited from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm evited the leaves from the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The security guard evited the trespasser from the premises.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic evited the faulty part from the engine.
meanings.sent2: The doctor evited the splinter from the patient's finger.
meanings.sent3: The magician evited the rabbit from the hat unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The wind evited the hat from the child's head.
meanings.sent5: The chef evited the burnt toast from the toaster before it caught fire.

meanings.sent1: The landlord evited the non-paying tenant from the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The bank evited the homeowners from their foreclosed property.
meanings.sent3: The ghost evited the new residents from the haunted house.
meanings.sent4: The king evited the traitor from the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The judge evited the squatters from the abandoned building.
